comment: A lot of work and the class was not organized very well but do the work and go to class and you'll be fine. She is always willing to help and very friendly.

I really enjoyed this class and Mrs. Henry. I learned a lot in her class and was provided with a lot of information that I will use when teaching. The class is a lot of work, but you will be glad you did it when the semester is over. I now realize I didn't have a clue how to teach reading and now I do.
This teacher gives too much work and grades harshly. When given feedback, she was rude and not helpful at all. Make sure you go to every class. Would never recommend her.
Great teacher! She really cares about her students. If you follow the rubrics and turn things in on time you will get an A.
So helpful. I learned so much. You will have to work for your grade and ask a lot of questions about assignments. I learned a lot though and she is super nice.
I love Mrs. Henry. I did have to ask a lot of questions about what exactly she wanted done for her assignments, but she always answered them clearly and quickly!  Lovely Class!
Nice lady, but hard class. She expects too much and gives little instruction on HUGE assinments. No wiggle room with your grade. attendance mandatory

Nice lady, but extremely hard class. I had a rough time in there, did my best, and got a B when I feel that I deserved an A. Slaved away on this huge field experience binder all semester only to get tons of points docked for having only a few minor things missing. Overwhelms you with too much info, but she at least provides it. Keep up in class!!

She is a very nice person and will help you with whatever you ask. She is just not very clear on things sometimes. She confused me with her explinations on what she wanted but I still got an A in the class. She is a good person and will make you laugh!

Mrs. Henry will stress you out. She is very helpful and gives you a lot of resources, but she bombards you with way too much information. She requires 11 detailed lessons, an author study presentation, a shared reading lesson plan and two multiple page reflections each week. Plus, you must read at least 3 chapters each week for class.

I don't really know how I feel about Mrs. Henry. She is really nice but it seems fake at times...lots of paperwork involved. If you are good at keeping up with lesson plan reflections every week, go for it. She requires very detailed lesson plans.
